newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end lower, hurt by NY fall, bank woes.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end lower, hurt by NY fall, bank woes.

text.p: Tokyo stocks ended moderately lower on the first day of the 1997/98 financial year on Tuesday, as Wall Street's overnight tumble hurt global shares, while bank woes renewed worries about Japan's financial system, brokers said.
The 225-share Nikkei average shed 133.81 points or 0.74 percent to 17,869.59. It briefly dipped to 17,529.05. Its June futures ended unchanged at 17,850.
"Today's news rekindled worries over the health of the financial system," said Akihiro Naemura, strategist at Okasan Securities Co Ltd.
